messages.content: ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion is a set of custom nodes in ComfyUI that allows users to utilize the InstanceDiffusion model for image and video generation.
Who developed the original research repo for InstanceDiffusion?
The original research repo for InstanceDiffusion was developed by frank-xwang.

To install ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion, clone or download the repo into your ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ directory. There are no additional Python package requirements outside of the standard ComfyUI requirements.
What are the three models that need to be downloaded and placed in the installation directory for ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion?
The three models that need to be downloaded and placed in the installation directory are fusers.ckpt, positionnet.ckpt, and scaleu.ckpt.
Which node repositories are recommended to accompany ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion?
The recommended accompanying node repositories for ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion are KJNodes for BBoxes, Tracking Nodes for videos, AnimateDiff-Evolved, and Video Helper Suite.
What are some example use cases for ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion?
Some example use cases for ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion include Text2Vid using Kijai's Spline Editor and Vid2Vid workflows, which can be found in the example_workflows/ directory.
Which input types are currently unsupported by ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion?

The currently unsupported input types for ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion are Scribbles, Points, Segments, and Masks. Points, segments, and masks are planned to be added after proper tracking for these input types is implemented in ComfyUI.
